TheWord.ScriptureReference: Deuteronomy 29:22, 1 Chronicles 29:15, Ephesians 2:19, Hebrews 11:13, Hebrews 13:2, 1 Peter 2:11, 3 John 1:5
TheWord.Title: There are no more, there are no more passengers.

Remember.Commentary: There are no more, there are no more passengers.
Remember.ScriptureReference: Deuteronomy 29:22, 1 Chronicles 29:15, Ephesians 2:19, Hebrews 11:13, Hebrews 13:2, 1 Peter 2:11, 3 John 1:5

BibleWord.Commentary: So that the generation to come of your children that shall rise up after you, and the stranger that shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses which the LORD has laid upon it (Deuteronomy 29:22). For we are strangers before You, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding (1 Chronicles 29:15). Now therefore you are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God (Ephesians 2:19). These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of them, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth (Hebrews 11:13). Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares (Hebrews 13:2). Dearly beloved, I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul (1 Peter 2:11). Beloved, you do faithfully whatsoever you do to the brethren, and to strangers (3 John 1:5).
